result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl W Moderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs/Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.
Maintain/Obtain full time employment and/or school.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommenced by Agent.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: First 5 Days are without work released. Remaining sentence-Non working Hours with Standard Release condition-To commence FORTHWITH.

records.addlTxt: Amended.

Defendant Carl W Moderson in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Huppertz makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  Court addresses fixing of the minutes from the Pleah Hearing to reflex that the penalty enhancer had been struck.  
The Court Orders the Following: #1

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
1 year jail, with out work release.  (Credit - 0 days).  
Term of Probation: 2 Years
Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain/Obtain full time employment and/or school;
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
Condition Time: 90 days huber, first 5 days are without work release, NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence immediately
COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
dated Nov 10, 2015 from Atty Matthew Huppertz, filed with two character letters, letter fromHorizon Healthcare, and WCS Pretrial Supervision Program
Sentencing hearing at 11-12-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Carl W Moderson in court with attorney Matthew Huppertz.  Attorney Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amendment of the defendants date of birth placed on the record.  His date of birth is 1/20/1991 NOT 1/29/1991.  State to file amended information. Repeat penalty enhancer has been struck.  Defendant pleads guilty to amended Count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of amended count #1.  Count # 2 is dismissed and read in.  Court schedules the sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
